page.title: 01INTRO TO WOMERSLEY AREA
page.content: Most of the area is very flat and low-lying and consists of Arable farmland,however,there is a quarry being worked close to Womersley,which is the only village in the area. All the farms in the area concentrate on Arable farming,each with roughly the same amount of land. There is also a dismantled railway line passing through,which used to go to Little Smeaton. As most of the industry is farming,the population is low,and most of the people work outside the area. Around the village of Womersley,a lot of the houses are privately owned providing a quiet residential area for the owners. All the roads are{B}roads,and farm tracks.There are no {A}roads.
